page.title: 09 Farming in Radcot area.
page.content: There are seven mixed farms in this area the largest being 550 acres. Some farms specialise in beef cattle but most have a milking herd, Freisans are definitely the most numerous cattle. At least two farms have small flocks of sheep. Recently, owing to new E.E.C. milk quotas, farmers have had to reduce their milking herds and consequently have increased acreages of arable land. Five of these farms are run as family businesses and offer employement to local workers. One farm is owned by a city businessman and is run by a manageress. The seventh farm is owned by a professional person who lives in the farmhouse and leases the land to a local farmer. In the past, small individual farms have been amalgamated to form the present more manageable areas.
